isis.stitle: NEWAY AIR SUSPENSION - REMOVE AND INSTALL - TRANSVERSE BEAM BUSHINGS

figure.caption: Figure 15. TRANSVERSE BEAM BUSHING Connection (With International Codes 14592, 14641, 14648, 14676,14677, 14686, 14689, 14692)
Figure 16. TRANSVERSE BEAM BUSHING CONNECTION (WITH INTERNATIONAL CODE 14682)

step1.para: Unload vehicle and block wheels to prevent vehicle from rolling. Raise vehicle frame 2 inches (51mm) and support with floor stands.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Exhaust air from vehicle and suspension system. Exhaust air by:

note.para: Even if air spring system has a leak and is deflated, the air must still be exhausted from system.

step2.para: Automatic control - height control valve - disconnect link at lower connection, then rotate control arm to exhaust (approximately 45 degrees down) position.
Disconnect air supply line from air spring.

step1.para: Disconnect shock absorbers and air springs at lower end.
Remove transverse beam. If it does not come off easily, place a porta-power between the axle and the transverse beam. NOTE: The steel sleeve bushings are split for ease of removal.

Remove old bushings. Clean bushing receptacle thoroughly of rubber debris and other foreign material. Inspect bushing receptacle for damage. Dress surface or replace beam if necessary. On single bushing connections, the Bushing Service Tool (refer to SPECIAL TOOLS) or adequate hydraulic press may be used to remove and install bushings.

important.para: When tightening bushing bolts or torque rod fasteners to specifications, the vehicle must be at proper ride height to avoid introducing unnecessary stress on the bushings.

step1.para: Lubricate new bushing using approved lubricant or soap solution. Do not use oil-based lubricant.

step2.para: On single bushing connections - insert new bushings in transverse beam (push past center, turn beam over and center in beam). Position transverse beam on equalizing beams. Proceed to Step 2.

On two bushing connectors - install new bushings onto equalizing beam with taper toward transverse beam. Position transverse beam on equalizing beams. Insert outer bushing into the transverse beam with the tapered end into it.

step1.para: Properly install washers and nuts, and tighten to 600 to 700 ft-lbs. (813 to 949 N•m). If "Smart Nuts" are used, refer to SPECIAL PROCESS WITH "SMART NUTS,".
Connect lower air springs, shock absorbers and height control valve linkage. Tighten air springs and shock absorbers to specified values found in Figure 21.
Install components removed to access the transverse beams. Build system air pressure to governor cut-out pressure and use soap solution to check for leaks.
